questions.question: Fill in the blank: While buyer personas help you understand who your customer is, Jobs to Be Done helps you understand your customer’s _____.
questions.answer: motivations

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using Jobs to Be Done?
questions.answer: All of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST way to uncover the job that people hire your product to do?
questions.answer: By interviewing individual customers.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a formal job story?
questions.answer: As a founder, when my company has grown beyond my ability to control it, I want to learn the strategies and design the playbooks that will help me guide the growth of my company, so that I can double the size of my company in the next three to five years.

questions.question: Which of the following is a problem with thinking of your business as a funnel?
answer: After something exits the bottom of a funnel, it no longer has any impact on the things entering the top of the funnel.
Movement through a funnel immediately stops when things stop flowing into the top of the funnel.

questions.question: In a flywheel business, which of the following is the most important source of new prospects?
questions.answer: Word-of-mouth

questions.question: Why is it common for companies to think of themselves in terms of a funnel?
questions.answer: Because many business charts show conversion rates, and those charts are often shaped like a funnel.

questions.question: What are the stages of the buyer’s journey?
questions.answer: Awareness, consideration, decision

questions.question: When in the buyer’s journey should you try to connect with a buyer?
questions.answer: Before the decision stage, when they are still defining their path forward

questions.question: True or false? Having reliable sales data is required to create an effective coaching program.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What are the steps of the GROW coaching technique?
questions.answer: Goal, Reality, Options, Way forward

questions.question: During the Goal step of GROW coaching, what is your role as coach?
questions.answer: Ask the salesperson what goal they would like to set.

questions.question: During the Reality step of GROW coaching, what is your role as coach?
questions.answer: Help the salesperson evaluate the reality of where they are right now.

questions.question: During the Way Forward step of GROW coaching, what is your role as coach?
questions.answer: Help the rep decide how they will achieve their goal and how you can support them.

questions.question: True or false? When you coach a salesperson, you should spend more time listening than talking.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of GROW coaching?
questions.answer: It places the responsibility for improvement on the person being coached.

questions.question: How can a film review be used as part of a coaching strategy?
questions.answer: As your team reviews a specific call or meeting one of your salespeople ran, other team members can give advice on how that salesperson can improve in the future.

questions.question: How can pipeline meetings be a coaching opportunity?
questions.answer: As your salespeople review each other’s pipeline, they can hold one another accountable and share best practices.

questions.question: True or false? A good sales process has enough flexibility to allow salespeople to adapt to the needs of individual prospects.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What are exit criteria?
questions.answer: The actions that have to be taken before a sales can move out of a particular stage of your sales process

questions.question: What is the “source of truth” for every sale’s status?
questions.answer: Your CRM

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: Each step of your sales process is a combination of _____ and _____.
questions.answer: A rep-focused action, a buyer-focused outcome

questions.question: True or false? You can forecast as accurately with an informal sales process as you can with a formal sales process.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: A colleague at another company has developed a sales process with four steps in it. They are concerned that the process is too short. What would you tell them?
questions.answer: “If the process is robust enough to support the needs of your sales team, it doesn’t matter how long or short it is.”

questions.question: Which of the following groups is the easiest to sell to?
questions.answer: Happy customers

questions.question: Which of the following should be included in your sales process?
questions.answer: Steps to ensure closed customers received the value your team promised them

questions.question: True or false? Making the steps of your sales process buyer-centric can be as simple as changing their names a little bit.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: True or false? Combining multiple methodologies causes confusion and low performance.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the best way to provide content to your sales team?
questions.answer: Provide them with a framework that helps them match specific pieces of content to the specific needs of their prospects.

questions.question: What format should your sales playbook be in?
questions.answer: An interactive digital format

questions.question: True or false? You need to continually evaluate how well your sales process is working.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What’s the sales manager’s role in the second phase of a sales training, when the training is reinforced?
questions.answer: Ensuring the salespeople who attended the training understood what was taught

questions.question: What’s the sales manager’s role in the third phase of a sales training, when the sales team converts knowledge into behavior?
questions.answer: Providing salespeople with a safe place to practice their new skills

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an ineffective coaching technique that should be avoided?
questions.answer: A salesperson is struggling to write a follow-up email, so the sales manager steps in and writes it for them.

questions.question: True or false? During coaching sessions, the salesperson needs to identify their own path forward.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What’s the best way to avoid making bad sales hires?
questions.answer: Develop a robust hiring process.

questions.question: True or false? The sales team needs to be using the same hiring process used by other departments.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: When hiring salespeople, what is the most important thing to look for?
questions.answer: The ability to execute your sales process

questions.question: When creating interview questions for sales hires, which of the following approaches is a best practice?
questions.answer: Create a different set of questions for each sales role, but use the same questions for all candidates for a particular role.

questions.question: Fill in the blanks: When building a recruiting strategy, building relationships with top sales talent at other companies is _____, while building relationships with high-performing business development reps at other companies is _____.
questions.answer: a long-term strategy, a short-term strategy

questions.question: Which of the following should be the primary focus of your sales onboarding program?
questions.answer: Your sales process and playbook

questions.question: Which of the following is a best practice for onboarding newly hired salespeople?
questions.answer: Cover the things they need to get started and train them on the rest later on when they need it.

questions.question: Which salesperson would most benefit from a coaching program?
questions.answer: An underperforming salesperson who is dedicated to improving

questions.question: If a highly dedicated salesperson is unable to improve their low sales performance despite coaching efforts, what is your best course of action?
questions.answer: Help them find a different role within your company.

questions.question: During the awareness stage of the buyer’s journey, what is the buyer becoming aware of?
questions.answer: A problem they have

questions.question: During the consideration stage of the buyer’s journey, what is the buyer considering?
questions.answer: Different categories of solutions

questions.question: Which of the following is true of most sales organizations?
questions.answer: They don’t coach their salespeople as much as they should.

questions.question: During the Options step of GROW coaching, what is your role as coach?
questions.answer: Help the salesperson explore their options for getting from where they currently are to where they want to be.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most important responsibility of a sales leader?
questions.answer: Making sure the sales team is following an effective sales process

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Every step of your sales process needs to be _____.
questions.answer: Required, factual, inspectable, and buyer-centric

questions.question: Which of the following has the biggest impact on potential leads?
questions.answer: Your existing customers’ word-of-mouth

questions.question: When choosing a sales methodology, what’s the most important thing to keep in mind?
questions.answer: How well the methodology will work with your process and your target persona

questions.question: What’s the sales manager’s role in the fourth phase of a sales training, when the team applies their new skills in the real world?
questions.answer: Holding team members accountable to integrating the training into their actual workflow

questions.question: What’s the sales manager’s role in the final phase of a sales training, where each team member continues to improve on the skill until they’ve fully mastered it?
questions.answer: Coaching individual team members to help them reach mastery

questions.question: True or false? During a training, having participants role play with each other is an effective way to build skills, even if there isn’t an experienced person evaluating the role play.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What’s the difference between training and coaching?
questions.answer: Training teaches salespeople what they need to do, and coaching helps them improve how they do it.

questions.question: True or false? Job interviews are highly predictive of how successful a person will be after they’re hired.
questions.answer: Failed to fetch page

questions.question: When building a recruiting strategy, which of the following is a good long-term tactic?
questions.answer: Building relationships with top sales talent at other companies

questions.question: True or False? Allowing salespeople to coach each other will distract from their primary responsibility of finding and closing new business.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: True or false? You need to define your target persona before you define your sales process.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What’s the sales manager’s role in the first phase of a sales training, when the team is learning something new?
questions.answer: Ensuring the selected topics are presented in a way that will drive improvements to the way the sales team executes the sales process

questions.question: True or false? At the end of a good onboarding program, the newly hired salesperson will know everything they’ll need to know in their new role.
questions.answer: False
